name: Melilotus
Relationship: Compare: MELILOT ALBA - (White Clover) - practically the same action. (Hemorrhages, congestive headaches, engorged blood vessels, spasms.) AMYL.; BELL.; GLON.

Head: Scalp sore and tender to touch
Fullness all over head
Eyes heavy; blurred sight; wants to close them tightly for relief
Heavy, oppressed; frontal, throbbing, undulating sensation in brain
Headache with retching, vomiting, sense of pressure over orbits, pallor, cold hands and feet, black spots before eyes
Sick headache; relieved by epistaxis or menstrual flow
Neuralgia around and over right side of head and neck
Respiratory: Feels as if smothering, especially from rapid walking
Stool: No desire until there is a large accumulation
Mind: Wants to run away and hide
Delusions; thinks everyone is looking at her, fears to talk loud, and wants to run away, etc.
Face: Intensely red and flushed, with throbbing carotids
Nose: Stopped up; dry, must breathe through mouth; dry, hard clinkers in nose; profuse epistaxis
Female: Menses scanty, intermit, with nausea and bearing-down
Extremities: Pain in knee; wants to stretch leg, but does not relieve

details: Congestions and hemorrhages seem to be the special manifestations of this drug. Violent congestive and nervous headaches. Infantile spasms. Epilepsy from blow on head. PAINS AND DEBILITY point to it. Coldness but also increase of temperature; tenderness, and pain. Muscular system depressed. Dreams and emissions.Hemorrhages, congestive headaches, engorged blood vessels, spasms.
